p: The increase in frequency and duration of wildfires places a large financial burden on federal and state governments. According to the National Interagency Fire Center, the U.S. Forest Service’s annual suppression costs have exceeded one billion dollars for 13 of the 18 years between 2000 and 2017 [ 3]. This is a significant increase in average annual costs from those between the years of 1985 and 1999, during which the total annual suppression costs never once exceeded one billion dollars.
